meanings.definition: A white metal alloy used in making imitation gold jewelry.
meanings.sent1: The jewelry was made of albata, a shiny white metal.
meanings.sent2: She wore a necklace made of albata to the party.
meanings.sent3: The albata bracelet looked like real gold, fooling everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her albata ring sparkled in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.
meanings.sent5: The albata earrings gleamed brightly under the store lights.

meanings.definition: To mix or alloy with a white metal.
meanings.sent1: He decided to albata the silver with another metal for a unique look.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler will albata the metal to create a new design.
meanings.sent3: She tried to albata the metals together, but it didn't work out.
meanings.sent4: The artist albataed the metals, creating a beautiful sculpture.
meanings.sent5: Albataing the metals required precision and skill.

meanings.sent1: The room was painted in a bright albata color.
meanings.sent2: She loved the albata hue of the walls in her bedroom.
meanings.sent3: The albata of the clouds against the blue sky was breathtaking.
meanings.sent4: The albata of the snow-covered landscape was serene and peaceful.
